word_mean: 偏向，偏转，转向：在精神分析上指意念从有意识转向下意识的
结构构件的轴线或中面由于弯曲引起垂直于轴线或中面方向的线位移。

sentence.Network_en: The smallest deflection of the missile could bring disaster.
sentence.Network_cn: 导弹有极微小的偏斜也可能酿出大祸.

sentence.Network_en: Starlight passing close to the sun should experience some deflection.
sentence.Network_cn: 从太阳近旁通过的星光会受到某种偏折.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from late Latin deflexio(n-), from deflectere 'bend away' (see deflect)

entry.def: The deflection of something means making it change direction.

example.ex: ...the deflection of light as it passes through the slits in the grating.
example.tran: 光线通过光栅狭缝时的偏转

entry.tran: (体育运动中球击中某物后的)转向，变向
entry.def: In sport, the deflection of a ball, kick, or shot is when the ball hits an object and then travels in a different direction.

means.word_mean: 1. a twist or aberration; especially a perverse or abnormal way of judging or acting
2. the amount by which a propagating wave is bent
3. the movement of the pointer or pen of a measuring instrument from its zero position
4. the property of being bent or deflected
5. a turning aside (of your course or attention or concern);

auth_sentence.content: The great deflection of the coast southward from Cape Wrath.
auth_sentence.res_content: The great deflection of the coast southward from Cape Wrath.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The great deflection of the coast southward from Cape Wrath.

auth_sentence.content: Methinks the gravitational deflection of light requires a better explanation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Methinks the gravitational deflection of light requires a better explanation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Methinks the gravitational deflection of light requires a better explanation.

auth_sentence.content: It took a big deflection, though - without the help of the deflection it wouldn't have gone in, so I was thankful for that!
auth_sentence.res_content: It took a big deflection, though - without the help of the deflection it wouldn't have gone in, so I was thankful for that!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It took a big deflection, though - without the help of the deflection it wouldn't have gone in, so I was thankful for that!

stems_affixes.word_buile: reflect[v.回想;反射]+ive……的→adj.深思熟虑的
deflect[v.[使]偏斜]+ion表名词→n.偏斜,歪斜;偏差
inflect[v.弯曲, 使屈曲, 改变, [语法]变化词尾或变形]+ion表名词→n.变形;词尾变化
reflect[v.回想;反射]+ion表名词→n.映像,倒影;反省,沉思
de离开+flect弯曲→离开[偏离]弯曲→偏斜

stems_affixes.value_cn: 曲膝半跪[以示敬意],屈从
stems_affixes.word_buile: genu膝盖+flect弯曲→膝盖弯曲→下跪

stems_affixes.value_cn: 弯曲, 使屈曲, 改变, [语法]变化词尾或变形
stems_affixes.word_buile: in使+flect弯曲→使弯曲,引申为单词后面的变化和原来不一样,如child变为children

means.word_mean: (尤指击中某物后)突然转向,偏斜,偏离

sentences.cn: 意外的偏离既定的道路
